snippet: A rift between conservatives and corporations widened as a bill protecting discrimination against gay people was signed in Mississippi and PayPal pulled out of North Carolina over a similar measure.
abstract: Laws related to gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender rights in two Southern states bring backlash; Mississippi's law allowing individuals and institutions with religious objections to refuse to serve gay couples brings objections from companies that are major employers in state, and North Carolina's approval of law banning anti-discrimination protections based on sexual orientation has caused PayPal to cancel $3.6 million plan for  global operations center in Charlotte.

byline.original: By JONATHAN M. KATZ and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Jonathan M. Katz reported from Durham, and Erik Eckholm from New York.

lead_paragraph: A rift between conservatives and corporations widened as a bill protecting discrimination against gay people was signed in Mississippi and PayPal pulled out of North Carolina over a similar measure.

headline.main: Anti-Gay Laws Bring Backlash in Mississippi and North Carolina
headline.print_headline: Laws Blocking Gay Rights Efforts Bring a Backlash in Two Southern States
